data.text:
It has been a number of decades since the originalÂ Top Gun film in 1986, however, the twenty-first century sequel,Â Top Gun: Maverick, released just last month has seen massive success around the world. The film, which was declared as the highest grossing movie in the United States, surpassing that ofÂ Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness, managed to bring in over $760 million worldwide. It has also seen huge levels of international demand in the month since its release. This article will cover this demand and potential factors influencing the success of this long-awaited Tom Cruise action flick.

Exceptional Initial Demand

The chart below shows the global demand forÂ Top Gun: Maverick over the past thirty days. It had an average level of 117.8 times more demand than the average film worldwide and reached a peak level of 166.6 times more demand than the average film worldwide. This has been an exceptional level of demand for the film, considering only 0.2 percent of films have reached this. With a large amount ofÂ good press regarding the Paramount Pictures film over the time since its release, it will be interesting to see how this continues over the next month. A number of outlets have even noted how the movie has goneÂ above and beyond that of the success of most Marvel films.

Top Markets

The chart below shows the markets with the most demand for theÂ Top GunÂ sequel over the last thirty days. The United States, the filmâs home market, is well above the rest on this list with 101.3 times more demand for the film than the average film. However, the markets that follow still have exceptional levels of demand as well. Great Britain, the second on this list, has 51.2 times more demand forÂ Top Gun: Maverick than the average film. Canada, New Zealand, and Australia are the markets that follow, which could suggest the film has been well received by audiences with a western culture. This being said, the exceptional levels of demand seen from Germany and India, both with over 34 times more demand forÂ Top Gun: Maverick than the average film, indicates the movie has been successful with a diverse range of cultures.

Rise in Demand for the OriginalÂ Top Gun

With the success of its sequel, the firstÂ Top GunÂ film, which was released in 1986, has seen a spike in demand. The chart below shows the shift in demand for the firstÂ Top Gun movie over the past month. On May 28th, one day after the release ofÂ Top Gun: Maverick, the original film reached 63.9 times more demand than the average film worldwide. This was a massive leap from the level of demand on May 21st, which was just under 40 times more global demand than the average film. Â This is an indication that the 2022 sequel has influenced the demand for the 1986 film in a positive way, at least in terms of its level of global demand.

Time Shift Analysis

The chart below shows the shift in demand for the top films worldwide over the past thirty days. A week after its release on May 27th,Â Top Gun: Maverick saw a huge spike in demand, growing from just above 90 times more demand than the average film to over 160 times more demand than the average film worldwide. At this time, the movie had almost double the level of demand than bothÂ Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness Â andÂ Spider-Man: No Way Home, which were the second and third most in demand films.

Another interesting point to note in regard to the above comparison is the consistency in earnings. WhileÂ Spider-Man: No Way Home, anÂ incredibly successfulÂ film in its own right from Marvel Studios,Â dropped by 67 percent in earnings during its second week - a common trend for blockbuster films after their first week after release. However,Â Top Gun: MaverickÂ only dropped by 29 percent in its second week. Some have suggested that the filmâs success in this way was influenced byÂ word of mouth, which may indicate why the film still pulled in $90 million during the second week after its release.

With a record-breaking success during its first month after release,Â Top Gun: Maverick has definitely made an impact around the world - over three decades after its first installment. Whether it was due to the circulation of good press for the film or because of the word of mouth between audiences, the newÂ Top Gun film saw a great turnout at its release, with a huge level of demand to show for it. With Tom Cruise as the filmâs lead, it will be interesting to see howÂ Mission: Impossible â Dead Reckoning Part One, which is set to release mid next year, will do in the wake of the newÂ Top Gunâs massive success.
